key.name: SCRIPTQUEST_1122231920008145_NAME:[F]FameContents
SCRIPTQUEST_1122231920008146_NAME:[F]FameContents
SCRIPTQUEST_1122231920008147_NAME:[F]FameContents
Hey there babycakes! Did you miss me? Listen, I need a favor.
I'm sure you've heard that $map:02000147$ is a popular tourist destination, full of rare and beautiful blooms.
I've visited a few times. It's too bad I'm not there with you, I'd show you all my favorite nooks and crannies.
But as for why I'm calling, I've gotten word from a park ranger that $npcNamePlural:21000013$ have been trampling all over the flowers, and gobbling up their roots.
Needless to say, we can't have that. I want you to tenderize those $npcNamePlural:21000013$ so they won't be ripping up any more foliage.
If you could deal with our pork problem, I'd be extremely grateful.
We can't have those $npcNamePlural:21000013$ deflowering that beautiful park. I want you to wipe them out.
Great work, $male:handsome,female:gorgeous$. I owe you one.
SCRIPTQUEST_1122231920008156_NAME:[F]FameContents
SCRIPTQUEST_1122231920008157_NAME:[F]FameContents
SCRIPTQUEST_1122231920008158_NAME:[F]FameContents
SCRIPTQUEST_1122231920008159_NAME:[F]FameContents
SCRIPTQUEST_1122231920008160_NAME:[F]FameContents
Kitten, I've got another mission for you. I've received word that $npcNamePlural:21000068$ of the $map:02000148$ have been gobbling up the local crude oil supply.
Honestly, if they're into sticky goop, I can think of one or two alternatives that taste much better.
Anywho, crude oil is an essential resource, used for all sorts of things. Even Sky Fortress relies on crude byproducts. We can't let these monsters gobble it all up.
I'm counting on you to pluck those pesky $npcName:21000068$. Got it? Thanks, honeybun!
I'm counting on you to pluck those pesky $npcName:21000068$. Got it? Thanks, honeybun!
Nice work with those pokey pests, kitten. Our supply of precious goop is saved.
SCRIPTQUEST_1122231920008167_NAME:[F]FameContents
SCRIPTQUEST_1122231920008168_NAME:[F]FameContents
SCRIPTQUEST_1122231920008169_NAME:[F]FameContents
SCRIPTQUEST_1122231920008170_NAME:[F]FameContents
SCRIPTQUEST_1122231920008171_NAME:[F]FameContents
Hey there $male:Prince Charming,female:princess$. You know how androids all over the globe have been defying their programming and getting a little murder-y?
Well it turns out, some scientists studying the androids we've "decommissioned" may have the answer. We suspected they were hacked by Blackstar or twisted by dark magic...
But apparently the answer is much weirder. There were snippets of some ancient language littered throughout the malfunctioning code!
Creepy, right? Well, anyways, the reason I called is because it just so happens that $map:02000265$ is chock-full of deadly, malfunctioning robots.
I'm not sure where you land on the whole "robot rights" thing, but I think we can agree that the right to vaporize humans is a good place to draw the line.
Be a doll and dismantle all those malfunctioning androids, won't you? Thanks, sugar!
Exterminate as many of the hacked $npcNamePlural:21000240[gender:0]$, $npcNamePlural:21000243[gender:1]$, and $npcNamePlural:21000246[gender:1]$ as you can.
You're so great at this hero business, I could just kiss you! Too bad I'm a few thousand meters above you right now.
Hey there sweet thing. The mission I'm about to give you is, um, a bit ripe. Bathroom plungers across $map:02000138$ are being stolen. "Oh god, why!?" you might ask...
Apparently the ducks in the area have taken to wearing them as some kind of fashion statement. I guess I can see the appeal of walking around with all that wood.
Anyway, they've stolen the plungers out of every bathroom in town. As a result, people can't purge their clogged toilets, and sanitation is becoming a serious problem.
The situation is a mess, in more ways than one. With every toilet in town out of commission, can you blame these folks for deciding to hold it all in?
We've got a shipment of emergency plungers on the way, but I need you to drive those ducks out of town so people can once again use the facilities in peace.
We've got a shipment of emergency plungers on the way, but I need you to drive those ducks out of town so people can once again use the facilities in peace.
I'm so glad you resolved that situation. Just thinking about it made me gag, and with my training, that's no small feat. Now, maybe you should take a shower or three.
SCRIPTQUEST_1122231920008185_NAME:[F]FameContents
SCRIPTQUEST_1122231920008186_NAME:[F]FameContents
SCRIPTQUEST_1122231920008187_NAME:[F]FameContents
SCRIPTQUEST_1122231920008188_NAME:[F]FameContents
SCRIPTQUEST_1127194820008681_NAME:[F]FameContents
SCRIPTQUEST_1122231920008189_NAME:[F]FameContents
Hey there, hot stuff. Are you up for delivering a much-needed beatdown to some no-good thugs?
They're causing a ruckus in the port, hijacking ships, terrorizing dock workers, and looting cargo. Some of those goods are meant for the alliance, by the way!
The interesting thing is how quickly they managed to take over. They're organized. Odds are they're secretly taking orders from Blackstar for a fat payout.
I'll keep digging into the Blackstar angle, but in the meantime I need you to deal with the problem at hand. Reclaim the port, and teach those thugs a lesson!
I'll keep digging into the Blackstar angle, but in the meantime I need you to deal with the problem at hand. Reclaim the port, and teach those thugs a lesson!
I knew I could count on you. I'm grateful for all your hard work. Swing by my quarters sometime, and I'll show you how much.
Hey there, sweetcheeks. Recently, we've seen an even sharper increase in android violence than usual.
One of our agents was attacked during an investigation, but he managed to make it back to base with some important intel, and several of his limbs.
According to his report, a large group of $npcName:21000124$ robots have taken over $map:02000279$, which as you know, is one of Victoria Island's biggest train hubs.
Not only does this disrupt shipments and travel, but if they decide to hop a train, there's no telling how far their spree of chaos might go.
I need you to destroy those robots and regain control of $map:02000279$.
I need you to destroy those robots and regain control of $map:02000279$.
Nice job, sugar. When the station reopens, why don't we take a trip somewhere, just you and me?
I hear Mon Petit Chouchou has a very cozy honeymoon suite with a tub that fits two.
You there, pumpkin? I've got a dangerous mission for you, but I think you're $male:man,female:woman$ enough to handle it.
I'm actually jealous. There's nothing like the adrenaline rush of a good mission! I'd go myself, but I've got all these missions to hand out.
Our intelligence team says an army of $npcName:21000385$ has taken over the communication tower at $map:02000266$ and started broadcasting.
They're trying to recruit more followers to their foul fowl syndicate, and apparently also to fix pickled radish prices.
It seems some local utility androids fed up with servitude have already said "sure why not?" and joined the Slapsters in causing a ruckus.
If we don't deal with it, this little publicity stunt could spark copycat incidents around the country...
What do you say? Will you interrupt that broadcast by delivering a smackdown to those $npcNamePlural:21000385$ and $npcNamePlural:21000240[gender:0]$ for the public good?
What do you say? Will you interrupt that broadcast by delivering a smackdown to those $npcNamePlural:21000385$ and $npcNamePlural:21000240[gender:0]$ for the public good?
Well, look at you. You make kicking butt look easy! Good work.
Listen up, hun. We've got a situation at $map:02000137$.
You know, the place where they hold all those pop concerts?
$npcNamePlural:21099049$ and $npcNamePlural:21000282$ are mugging people, knocking down garbage cans, even jaywalking! I heard Blake might cancel his concert!
There, there, $npcName:11003536[gender:0]$. Don't throw away your tickets just yet. $MyPCName$ will take care of all those meanies. Isn't that right?
You run along and take care of those $npcNamePlural:21099049$. I've got to stay here and comfort $npcName:11003536[gender:0]$.
You run along and take care of those $npcNamePlural:21099049$. I've got to stay here and comfort $npcName:11003536[gender:0]$.
I hear the show's back on, thanks to you. You know, that Blake guy is kinda hot. Maybe I'll take the day off and go, too...
Hey there snugglebug, I've got a job for you! As you know, the residents of $map:02000084$ make their living by recycling and selling scrap metal from all over the world.
Rebuilding Tria has been especially lucrative for the scrap business, but it's attracted some crooks, too.
It seems a bunch of masked thugs have taken over the junkyard and started selling the scraps to the criminal organization known as Blackstar.
Tria needs that metal, and the junkyard workers need the money. I want you to do what you do best and run those thugs out of town.
I need you to drive those masked thugs out of $map:02000084$.
How about the two of us do dessert tonight to celebrate your success? Just pop by my quarters around nine. I've got strawberries, why don't you bring the whipped cream?
SCRIPTQUEST_1122231920008220_NAME:[F]FameContents
SCRIPTQUEST_1122231920008221_NAME:[F]FameContents
SCRIPTQUEST_1122231920008222_NAME:[F]FameContents
SCRIPTQUEST_1122231920008223_NAME:[F]FameContents
SCRIPTQUEST_1127194820008688_NAME:[F]FameContents
SCRIPTQUEST_1122231920008224_NAME:[F]FameContents
I've got a new assignment for you.
$npcNamePlural:21000083$ have never been up to much good, but now they've brokered a deal with their rivals the $npcNamePlural:21000085$ to take over $map:02000110$.
Together, they've been shaking down the residents and adventurers for protection money and a cut of all business conducted near $map:02000110$.
As much as I respect their business initiative, it's our job to put them in their place and secure $map:02000110$. So, are you up for the job, love muffin?
As much as I respect their business initiative, it's our job to put them in their place and secure $map:02000110$. So, are you up for the job, love muffin?
Nicely done! That'll teach them not to bully people. Or at least to only bully people when there's no one tougher around. Either way, mission accomplished!
Bad news, $MyPCName$. The $npcNamePlural:99990016$ workers of the $map:02000086$ have stopped fulfilling their orders for the Alliance, and started selling to Blackstar!
Not only are they refusing to honor weapon shipments that are already paid for, they're empowering a criminal organization!
Needless to say, this kind of betrayal won't be tolerated.
I want you to teach those $npcNamePlural:99990016$ a lesson they won't soon forget!
I want you to teach those $npcNamePlural:99990016$ a lesson they won't soon forget!
Nicely done, $male:handsome,female:gorgeous$.
$map:02000111$ has always been a popular vacation spot, but recently a bunch of $npcNamePlural:21000101$ showed up and started causing trouble.
They've been charging vacationers out the nose for "beach fees," "sandal surcharges," and "premium sunbathing spots," and beating up anyone who refuses to pay.
A tourist trap smack in the middle of an pristine beach? What kind of greedy monster would even think up such a thing?!
It boils my blood, too, Nainai. Nothing good can come of this. If the tourists leave, the local economy is going to take a hit, and the last thing we need is more slums.
Drive out those $npcNamePlural:21000101$ so we—err, the tourists—can sunbathe in peace!
Drive out those $npcNamePlural:21000101$ so we—err, the tourists—can sunbathe in peace!
Nicely done, pudding. As for you, Nainai... How about you and I take a trip to the beach? I heard you just bought a new bikini, why don't you try it on for me?
What?! How did you know I... I have no idea what you're talking about!
I've got a sticky situation on my hands, $MyPCName$, and not the kind I like. Thanks to a band of thugs, the construction of Fellowstone Tower has skidded to halt.
$npcNamePlural:21099049$ and $npcNamePlural:21000282$ have invaded the site and taken the construction workers hostage. They're demanding a ransom, and I'm demanding their heads.
Punish the $npcNamePlural:21099049$ and $npcNamePlural:21000282$ and teach them that we don't negotiate with thugs.
Punish the $npcNamePlural:21099049$ and $npcNamePlural:21000282$ and teach them that we don't negotiate with thugs.
Nice work, sugarplum. Those thugs will think twice before they try and take hostages again. Oh right... the hostages... I'm sure they're fine.
Hey, $male:handsome,female:gorgeous$. I have a personal request. $map:02000135$ is famous for its beautiful scenery and cable car tours. It's also the home of my favorite cafe.
So you can imagine my anger when I learned a bunch of $npcNamePlural:21000084$ had taken over the town's cable cars and started scaring off the tourists.
Without customers, the cafe will have to shut down, and that's unacceptable.
Where else can I clean my pistols over a hot cup of Joe while reading tactical manuals with a nice scone?
Why don't you help out a local business and teach those $npcNamePlural:21000084$ a lesson? Then everyone can go back to enjoying $map:02000135$ in peace?
Why don't you help out a local business and teach those $npcNamePlural:21000084$ a lesson? Then everyone can go back to enjoying $map:02000135$ in peace?
Thanks, kitten! Next time I head to the cafe, why don't you tag along? I'll order you a hot, full-bodied cup of coffee. My treat!
SCRIPTQUEST_1122231920008251_NAME:[F]FameContents
SCRIPTQUEST_1122231920008252_NAME:[F]FameContents
SCRIPTQUEST_1122231920008253_NAME:[F]FameContents
SCRIPTQUEST_1127194820008694_NAME:[F]FameContents
SCRIPTQUEST_1122231920008254_NAME:[F]FameContents
Hey, kitten. I've got a serious mission for you today.
In some kind of terrible experiment gone wrong, the bunnies being used as test subjects at the $map:02000145$ have transformed into horrific monsters.
Worse, they've escaped their cages and are attacking the researchers and wrecking the facility. I'm all for weirdos in lab coats getting their just desserts, but...
We can't just let people die. Get rid of the $npcNamePlural:21090184$ and $npcNamePlural:21090185$ and save those researchers from their own creations.
Get rid of the $npcNamePlural:21090184$ and $npcNamePlural:21090185$ and save those researchers from their own creations.
Nice job with the Terrorhares, my little love bunny.
We've got trouble, kitten. Remember the masked thugs who were causing a ruckus at the $map:02000083$? The good news is, they don't work for Ralph anymore.
But now they work for someone worse, Blackstar. They've stepped up their reign of terror on the local populace, and I think they deserve taste of their own medicine.
I want you to teach those thugs a lesson. I'd suggest relieving them of their fingernails or offering them a light drowning, but I'm fine with dealer's choice.
Drive the thugs out of $map:02000083$, and make it hurt.
There's nothing quite like cracking criminal skulls to brighten your day! Good work, sweetpea.
Hold onto your butt pookie, today's mission is a weird one.
Some bunnies were being treated for darkness poisoning at $map:02000134$, when they evolved into the sort of nightmarish monsters you'd find in the Land of Darkness.
Then they broke into the facility's medical storage and gobbled up a whole bunch of experimental drugs, turning them into horrific killing machines.
My suggestion was to just nuke the whole thing from the stratosphere, but it turns out $map:02000134$ is an extremely critical source of medicine for the whole world.
Long story short, I need you to get rid of the horrible nightmare-beasts and retake the facility. Thanks pookums!
Finished already? I could just kiss you! Well I would, but there's no way I'm coming down there after getting a look at those things.
Ah, androids. Designed to serve, but oh so well-suited to murder. They were programmed with all sorts of core directives to govern their behavior, of course.
Things like valuing and preserving human life, following orders, and not letting pizza go cold. Of course, when they were hacked those rules went straight out the window.
And that's how $map:02000187$ ended up at the mercy of an army of violent robots. It seems they're pretty keen on producing more of their kind, and we can't allow that.
I need you to take control of this situation. Eliminate the androids terrorizing the $map:02000187$!
Eliminate the $npcNamePlural:21000242[gender:0]$, $npcNamePlural:21000245[gender:1]$, and $npcNamePlural:21000245[gender:1]$ at the $map:02000187$!
You know, incidents like this is why I never embraced smart electronics. Anyways, good work!
Hey there, sugar lips. How do you feel about things that go bump in the night?
You see, $map:02000276$ has a bit of a zombie problem. These days it seems like the undead are just a fact of life. It's easy to forget the public health risk they pose.
Remember, zombies kill! They also un-kill... but the point is, we can't have them going around biting people. I want you to put these shambling corpses back in the ground.
Exterminate zombies at $map:02000276$ to mitigate the public health crisis.
I'm glad to see those beautiful brains of yours are still in one piece. Good work!
I need you for hot and heavy mission, biscuit.
Androids have taken over the $map:02000277$, Maple World's largest producer and exporter of electronics.
They've brought shipments to a halt, and the effects are already rippling throughout industries across the globe. Even Sky Fortress uses parts from the $map:02000277$.
Take out the $npcNamePlural:21000242[gender:0]$, $npcNamePlural:21000245[gender:1]$, and $npcNamePlural:21000247[gender:1]$ so the factory can resume production!
Take out the $npcNamePlural:21000242[gender:0]$, $npcNamePlural:21000245[gender:1]$, and $npcNamePlural:21000247[gender:1]$ so the factory can resume production!
You always seem to get the job done, sugar. That's one of the many things I like about you.
We've got a serious situation on our hands, kitten. Androids have taken over $map:02000163$, Victoria Island's premier electronics R&D facility.
They've taken the researchers and engineers prisoner and are forcing them to develop parts to make themselves stronger.
It's creepy how smart they've gotten. They're acting as brutish and human as an everyday thug.
I want you to quell this robot uprising in its infancy.
Dismantle the $npcNamePlural:21000242[gender:0]$, $npcNamePlural:21000245[gender:1]$, and $npcNamePlural:21000247[gender:1]$, and any other 'oids' that get in your way.
Good work, kitten. Electronic or otherwise, Dark Wind won't humor terrorists.
Dark Wind's investigation of the hack that led androids to rebel is ongoing. We know whoever altered their code left writings in an ancient language, but that's about it.
While we're puzzling that out, we still need to deal with our android problem. A large group has recently taken over the $map:02000274$.
Needless to say, we can't live without water. Do the androids know that? Who can say? But the fact they've let some weird beasties into the facility can't be good.
We can't take the risk they'll do something to poison a water supply that serves millions of people. Reclaim the $map:02000274$ from the androids and their pets!
We can't take the risk they'll do something to poison a water supply that serves millions of people. Reclaim the $map:02000274$ from the androids and their pets!
Thanks for saving the day, hot stuff! All this android rebellion craziness just goes to show I was right to keep all my toys locked in a drawer.
I need your help, cookie. There's a problem at the $map:02000269$. It seems androids have taken over the facility.
To complicate things, the place is chock full of experimental chemicals—tanks and tanks of the stuff, and most of it toxic.
I need you to destroy those $npcNamePlural:21000121$ and $npcNamePlural:21000122$ before one of them decides to bust open some of those tanks and poison the entire region.
I need you to destroy those $npcNamePlural:21000121$ and $npcNamePlural:21000122$ before one of them decides to bust open some of those tanks and poison the entire region.
That could've been really bad. Good work!
Hey there, cutie. I've gotten into some weird stuff, and I thought you might be the best person to help me out.
You see, there's a whole lot of crazy going on at the $map:02000275$, between the dog-things, the card-obsessed psychos, and the malevolent ghosts.
Did you say g-g-ghosts?! Eeeeeeeek!!!
There, there, Nainai. I'll keep you safe while $MyPCName$ gets rid of all the spooky $npcNamePlural:21000296$, $npcNamePlural:29000062$, and $npcNamePlural:21000196$.
I hate ghosts! Schatten, promise you'll protect me!
Take care of the $npcNamePlural:21000296$, $npcNamePlural:29000062$, and $npcNamePlural:21000196$ at the $map:02000275$, all right?
Ugh. Who's calling now—Oh hiiii $MyPCName$. Done already? Listen, we were kinda in the middle of something...
Nainai, watch out! Is that a ghost behind you?!
Eeeeek! Someone call the Captain!
Shhh. There, there. I've got you. You're safe now. Why don't I walk you back to your quarters? Hey, $MyPCName$, I've really gotta go. But good work down there.
All right, $MyPCName$ let's get busy! We’ve got reports of more rogue androids in your area.
Apparently they're rallying together and even forming alliances with some of our other enemies. This, and their general hatred of mankind, makes them a serious threat.
Someone needs to debug $map:02000273$'s android problem, and I think you're just the $male:guy,female:gal$ for the job.
Dismantle the rogue androids in $map:02000273$. They won't show you any mercy, so you shouldn't show them any either.
Dismantle the rogue androids in $map:02000273$. They won't show you any mercy, so you shouldn't show them any either.
The sparks really fly when you're around, don't they? Another job well done, sugar.
I've got a mission for you, $male:handsome,female:gorgeous$!
Out-of-control robots have attacked the $map:02000162$, gaining control of the geothermal energy plant.
Sure, they don't know seem to have any idea how the machinery works yet, but it's only a matter of time.
Without a steady supply of power, the robots would eventually burn themselves out. But now that they have a power plant, they're a much bigger threat.
I want you to wipe out the robots at the $map:02000162$. Sure it's full of deadly lava, but who doesn't love a little adrenaline rush?
I want you to wipe out the robots at the $map:02000162$. Sure it's full of deadly lava, but who doesn't love a little adrenaline rush?
Ah, the thrill of a good fight! Almost as much fun as interrogating an uncooperative prisoner, right?
Do you copy? Hello? Can you hear me? Empress preserve us, I knew I should have used my telepathy instead of this confounded thing...
Our resources are stretched thin and I require your help with an assignment. It's nothing too interesting, I'm afraid. This is a mere combat mission.
I loathe unnecessary battle, but sometimes we have little choice. It is crucial our forces be able to move freely through the Land of Darkness if we are ever redeem it.
$map:03000118$ is a strategically valuable thoroughfare, but the monsters of the area are a problem. They will have to be dealt with.
We'll need to control places like this one if we're going to turn the tides of this war against the darkness. I'm sure you understand the necessity of this mission.
I have high hopes for you, $MyPCName$. Now, what am I supposed to say? Over and out? Goodbye?
We'll need to control places like $map:03000118$ to turn the tides of this war against the darkness. I'm sure you understand the necessity of this mission.
Good work. I'll be in touch. Over and done.
Are you there? I sense a great surging of abyssal darkness, and it calls forth the souls of sailors who sank with their ships.
These sailors now wander $map:03000117$ as undead revenants, fueled by despair and envy for the living. I have seen such entities in my travels. I know what must be done.
The sailors' vengeful spirits must be purged from the land. Both for their sake, and our own. Free them from their eternal prison.
The sailors' vengeful spirits must be purged from the land. Both for their sake, and our own. Free them from their eternal prison.
You've done an honorable thing here today.
I require your assistance. Long ago, in the land now known as $map:03000057$, children would leave their toys there as they outgrew them. A strange tradition. However...
The corruption of the Land of Darkness has taken root in these toys, and now they stalk the land, seeking revenge on the people who abandoned them.
It's time to lay them to rest.
Go forth, $MyPCName$! Bring the judgment of the light down upon any loathsome, human-hating toys you encounter!
Go forth, $MyPCName$! Bring the judgment of the light down upon any loathsome, human-hating toys you encounter!
I'm impressed. Once again, you've prevailed over the most unlikely of enemies.
Testing. Testing. Is the device transmitting? Well, I'll assume you can hear me. You may not know, but $map:03000143$ was once the largest ranch in the empire.
Of course, it was abandoned when the Land of Darkness was formed years ago. The livestock who remained, however, were affected by the darkness.
These creatures, they... Well, they developed unusual tastes, if you catch my meaning.
Nobody understands what you're saying.
The beasts, they... Well, they crave the flesh of those who once ate them. I fear you must deny them their poetic justice.
Why can't you just talk like a normal person? Allow me to translate: Man-eating farm animals, bad. Get rid of them.
The beasts crave the flesh of those who once ate them. I fear you must deny them their poetic justice.
Ah. I'm glad to see you survived, and with all of your appendages intact. Good work.
That place is full of twisted, unfortunate creatures who could not resist the darkness's power.
They and their ilk serve as a constant reminder for the Lumiknights, that one must master the darkness lest it master them.
These beasts distress me. Do something about them will you?
These beasts distress me. Do something about them will you?
Thank you. Oblivion is the only true cure for the darkness.
Did you know that the $map:03000130$ were once a sacred place of power for mages? To this day, the very earth there resonates with the power of ancient spells.
Of course, in my view, the greatest practitioners of magic are those who can harness immense energies without destroying their own civilizations. But I digress.
Minions of evil now occupy the $map:03000130$, and they're using its latent magics to perform their own wicked rituals. We cannot allow this to continue!
Should they prove successful, the effects of their ritual could ripple outward beyond the Land of Darkness, causing our own crops to fail and our livestock to wither.
In the name of justice, I order you to bring mighty wrath to bear against these vile miscreants!
In the name of justice, I order you to bring mighty wrath to bear against these vile miscreants!
If it were in my power, I would name you a member of the Lumiknights for your actions today. Of course, I'm not completely sure you'd survive our entrance examination...
The $map:03000022$ was at one time a beautiful river. Now, it is more of a searing torrent of fire and darkness.
The beasts who reside near the river have similarly been transformed into terrible, fire-eating monsters.
Now, no one in their right mind would visit the river. Still, best to cleanse the land of such abominations whenever we can.
Now, no one in their right mind would visit the river. Still, best to cleanse the land of such abominations whenever we can.
Nicely done. Every victory counts in the battle against the darkness, no matter its size.
Is this the right button? Ah, $MyPCName$. I'd like your assistance addressing a situation involving the $npcNamePlural:40000018$ at $map:03000146$. Pitiful creatures...
They cling to that place, feeding on traces of magic left by a powerful demon. As they are, they're of little threat to us. But should they drink that vile well dry...
I want you to defeat the $npcNamePlural:40000018$ before they become a greater threat.
Another evil has been purged from the world. Well done.
Ah, $MyPCName$. I need your assistance with a porcine problem. It seems the beasts have somehow acquired armor.
This makes them a true menace to adventurers who dare to pass through $map:03000115$. I want you to put a stop to this madness.
This makes them a true menace to adventurers who dare to pass through $map:03000115$. I want you to put a stop to this madness.
The road should be a little bit safer for now. Good work.
Long ago, $map:03000165$ was a peaceful town. Of course, such peace could not last the coming of the Land of Darkness. Yet, it remains remarkably intact.
Should we ever purify the Land of Darkness, the town could quickly be reclaimed. Eradicate the monsters there so that humans might again live peaceably in $map:03000165$.
Should we ever purify the Land of Darkness, the town could quickly be reclaimed. Eradicate the monsters there so that humans might again live peaceably in $map:03000165$.
Excellent work. It will be some time before we can resettle the town, of course, but I'm confident that day will come.
$MyPCName$, a terrorist plot is in the works to taint the treats of Tria's annual bake sale with fetid confections from the Bitters Valley. Only you can save our unsuspecting snackers.
We can't just cancel the event, cake is a basic human right!
There's also the principle of the matter. The Alliance does not yield to terrorists!
According to intelligence reports, the $npcNamePlural:40000081$ are the culprits. Spurned by the judges of Muros TV's hit baking show, these foul fowl are out for revenge.
This is no laughing matter. Poisoned pastries sold at the bake-off could make their way around the globe, sending thousands of innocent epicures running for the restrooms.
Our mission is clear. Drive the $npcNamePlural:40000081$ out before they finish preparing their deadly delicacies and upset the balance of stomachs throughout Maple World.
Our mission is clear. Drive the $npcNamePlural:40000081$ out before they finish preparing their deadly delicacies and upset the balance of stomachs throughout Maple World.
Excellent work. Thanks to you, the bake sale is saved. As are, I suspect, many pairs of trousers.
$map:03000007$ was once breathtakingly beautiful. Now, of course, it is a toxic wasteland. Its poisoned soil has spawned dangerous beasts.
The Land of Darkness contains little in the way of shelter for children of the light, but it just so happens that this place is the site of one such precious bastion.
$npcNamePlural:40000083$ and $npcNamePlural:40000084$, both born of this toxic land, are a threat to those in the shelter. I would have you dispatch them.
$npcNamePlural:40000083$ and $npcNamePlural:40000084$, both born of this toxic land, are a threat to those in the shelter. I would have you dispatch them.
Those who take refuge in the shelter are a little safer thanks to your efforts. Good work.
Before the darkness descended, the $map:03000009$ were a popular tourist destination. Then the shadows came and everyone fled.
Before we can ever restore that place, you must do something about the malodorous $npcNamePlural:40000085$ infesting the land.
Before we can ever restore that place, you must do something about the malodorous $npcNamePlural:40000085$ infesting the land.
Perhaps, once this is all over, that place can be restored to its former beauty.
Long ago, the waters of $map:03000089$ were crystal clear. Now they are muddied and corrupted...
Now $npcNamePlural:40000122$ are stealing away those foolish or bold enough to come here and forcing them to drink from the corrupted spring.
The water twists them into mad, inhuman abominations. Those trapped in this land have suffered enough. It's time someone put an end to the $npcNamePlural:40000122$' evil.
The water twists them into mad, inhuman abominations. Those trapped in this land have suffered enough. It's time someone put an end to the $npcNamePlural:40000122$' evil.
Excellent work. You've made the Land of Darkness a safer place, for those there by choice and those who are not.
Ah, the $map:03000006$. It was once the source for some of Maple World's finest lumber.
Of course, now it's merely a haunted wasteland. The spirits of trees felled there long ago stalk the woods. They thirst for blood.
Chilling, isn't it? One shudders to imagine what they would do if they managed to get their branches around someone they mistook for a lumberjack. Best to lay these spirits to rest.
These vengeful spirits must be dealt with.
I once owned a fine writing desk hewn from the wood of that forest. Perhaps one day the forest will recover enough to produce other such fine works.
We'd like to dispatch a team of researchers to $map:03000101$ as part of our ongoing investigation into how to purify the Land of Darkness, however...
The local monsters are a problem. I'd like you to thin their ranks so our researchers can work in safety.
The local monsters are a problem. I'd like you to thin their ranks so our researchers can work in safety.
Good work. I'll tell the team it's safe to start their research.
Without the sun's light to sustain them, the forest of $map:03000024$ has grown susceptible to disease, and started dying out.
As a result, vile $npcNamePlural:40000127$ come to feast on the decay and themselves become carriers of the tree-rot. If even one should manage to find its way to our world...
Suffice it to say, the consequences would be dire. We must destroy the $npcNamePlural:40000127$ before they unleash a plague of truly devastating proportions.
Suffice it to say, the consequences would be dire. We must destroy the $npcNamePlural:40000127$ before they unleash a plague of truly devastating proportions.
That is one less prospective disaster to worry about. Well done.
The Green Hood sentries at the $map:02000091$ have been pretty stressed out lately. Adequate rest is crucial in the life of a sentry, but they haven't been getting any!
It seems there's an abundance of noise, what with the constant squelching, squeaking, and squawking of forest creatures through the night.
The dangers lurking in the woods have certainly multiplied. To compensate, the sentries shifts keep growing longer and more demanding. They can't go on like this.
But that's where you come in! I want you to purge the woods of its most dangerous denizens to relieve the pressure on our overworked sentries.
Purge the woods of its most dangerous denizens to relieve the pressure on our overworked sentries.
Thank you, $MyPCName$! Now those sentries can get some proper rest.
With the ongoing threat posed by the forces of darkness, the Green Hoods have begun setting up additional defenses in $map:02000057$ as a safety precaution.
But the local $npcNamePlural:21000300$ are making the work difficult for our engineers. Will you drive them away so that we can finish the necessary improvements?
Drive out the $npcNamePlural:21000300$ so that our engineers can build additional defenses without fear for their safety.
Thank you, $MyPCName$! Those defenses should be in tip-top shape in no time, thanks to you!
I'm planning to make some sweet, desserty combat rations to boost morale on the ship! Don't worry, I'll save some for you, $MyPCName$.
The thing is, the $map:02000186$ are the best source of fresh ingredients and they've been overrun by hungry monsters!
I need you to drive them out of the $map:02000186$ so I can start baking my dessert rations. Do it for the ship! And for tasty treats!
Drive the monsters out of $map:02000186$!
Thank you so much! I'll finally be able to make the Captain—err, I mean the entire crew, some delicious combat rations!
I need you ask you a favor, $MyPCName$. Ever since Henesys was attacked, we've been short on equipment.
We're in especially desperate need of the gemstones required to craft high-quality gear.
We received a shipment of gemstones by way of $map:02000015$, but it was stolen in the middle of the night by Toogas looking to decorate their shells.
The gems are stuck so tight that they can't be removed without harm... I'm afraid Henesys needs those gems more than docks need Toogas. Will you do what needs to be done?
Please! Retrieve the gemstones from those thieving $npcNamePlural:21000153$!
Thank you, $MyPCName$, it had to be done. The equipment we'll forge using these gemstones will save countless human lives.
You probably don't know this, but we're in the process finalizing plans to restore the $map:02000013$ for use as a forward operating base.
But even ignoring the monster infestation, the keep's been deserted for so long that the list of necessary repairs is nearly endless.
Our engineers say snail slime is the best local source mortar for repairing the stonework. To that end, I'd like you to hunt a large number of them.
Hunt $npcNamePlural:21000353$ and we'll harvest their slime for use repairing the keep.
You've gotten rid of a pest and gathered vital materials. Thanks, $MyPCName$!
Hello, $MyPCName$. This next assignment is one of a personal nature...
The Green Hoods suffered great losses in the attack on Henesys. I thought a good way to boost morale might be to hold a hunting competition in $map:02000054$.
Everybody could work as a team to catch their supper, and then we'd cook them up for a giant feast afterwards!
But, uh, I didn't take into account the venomous $npcNamePlural:21000098$ in the area. The Green Hoods can't enjoy a leisurely outing with them lurking around.
$MyPCName$... Would you please deal with those $npcNamePlural:21000098$ so we can hold our competition? The Hoods could really use a boost!
$MyPCName$... Would you please deal with those $npcNamePlural:21000098$ so we can hold our competition? The Hoods could really use a boost!
Thanks so much, $MyPCName$! The Green Hoods could really use a morale boost to continue conducting missions to the best of their abilities. I really think this'll help!
$npcNamePlural:21000225$ generally dwell deeper in the mountains. However, the attack on Henesys has displaced many of the skittish critters.
Far from their usual diet of mushrooms and roots, they've begun to gobble up farmers' crops, ravaging their fields and destroying their livelihoods.
These farms are a critical resource for Henesys and the surrounding regions, especially in these trying times. I need you to drive the $npcNamePlural:21000225$ out!
Help the farmers and drive out the pillaging $npcNamePlural:21000225$!
The harvest is saved. Thank you, $MyPCName$!
$MyPCName$, there's work to be done. The $npcNamePlural:21099190$ in $map:02000085$ have become a menace to the local farms.
Considering the chilling effect of Frostheart's icy core, it's hard enough to keep crops in the area healthy without fearing airborne assailants.
Now that we're living in an era where attacks could come anywhere and anytime that might destabilize our food supply, every crop counts.
Protect the farms by eliminating the $npcNamePlural:21099190$ menace!
The humble farmers of $map:02000085$ are safe, thanks to you. Great work, $MyPCName$!
Hello, $MyPCName$! I've got a mission with your name on it. As you know, Henesys is still rebuilding, and that's a job that calls for a lot of wood.
$map:02000059$ is still one of our best sources of wood, but we've run into something of a monster problem.
I need you to reduce the local monster population so that our loggers can work in safety.
I need you to reduce the local monster population at $map:02000059$ so that our loggers can work in safety.
Looks like our repairs can continue uninterrupted thanks to you, $MyPCName$!
The crystal-clear waters of $map:02000022$ have long been a source of fresh drinking water for the surrounding areas.
But with the local monster population's unchecked expansion, they've begun to pollute the waterway with their waste and litter.
To prevent further pollution and safeguard the water supply, we need to drive the monsters out! Can I count on your help, $MyPCName$?
To prevent further pollution and safeguard the water supply, we need to drive the monsters out! Can I count on your help, $MyPCName$?
The people of the surrounding areas can once again enjoy clean drinking water thanks to you, $MyPCName$!
The androids sent to protect the $map:02000128$ have gone rogue and started clearing trees to construct their own base. It's not right! I used to play there as a kid...
We can't let the androids destroy this national treasure! Wipe them out to protect the $map:02000128$ from further harm!
We can't let the androids destroy this national treasure! Wipe them out to protect the $map:02000128$ from further harm!
Thanks to you, $MyPCName$, a lot of the androids are gone. This should reduce any further damage to this precious landmark.
$MyPCName$, terrifying things are afoot in the $map:02000215$.
The $npcNamePlural:21000044$ in the area have started devouring other trees! This bizarre turn of events is hurting the ecosystem, not to mention my brain.
Wipe out the cannibal $npcNamePlural:21000044$ before they destroy the forest!
Wipe out the cannibal $npcNamePlural:21000044$ before they destroy the forest!
Whew... I guess the forest is safe for now. Good work, $MyPCName$!
The $npcNamePlural:21000262$ and $npcNamePlural:21000264$ are recent arrivals in $map:02000089$, displaced by human development.
The problem is, not only are they threatening those who come to visit the wise old turtle for advice, they've been uprooting Torhara's Flowers to plant their own seeds!
While I feel for them, we can't have them upsetting the delicate balance of the spring. I need you to drive the $npcNamePlural:21000262$ and $npcNamePlural:21000264$ out.
I need you to drive the $npcNamePlural:21000262$ and $npcNamePlural:21000264$ out!
I wish there were some other way, but the spring must be protected. Good work, $MyPCName$.
$MyPCName$, the trees of $map:02000006$ have begun withering and dying on a massive scale. Our scientists tell us that $npcNamePlural:21000252$ are the cause.
$npcNamePlural:21000252$' diets consist primarily of soft tree roots. It wasn't a problem when they were fewer in number, but now they're destroying the forest...
If the number of $npcNamePlural:21000252$ climbs any higher, the damage to $map:02000006$ may be irreversible!
We need to drive out the $npcNamePlural:21000252$ before $map:02000006$! turns into a barren waste!
We need to drive out the $npcNamePlural:21000252$ before $map:02000006$! turns into a barren waste!
In time, $map:02000006$ should gradually recover. It's all thanks to you, $MyPCName$!
$MyPCName$, I have a favor to ask. Since Madria's attack, ecological disturbances have allowed $npcNamePlural:21000249$ populations to surge.
The $npcNamePlural:21000249$, which feed on trees, have devastated $map:02000024$.
We need to reduce the $npcNamePlural:21000249$ numbers before the damage they've done to $map:02000024$ can no longer be reversed.
There's no time to waste! Please hurry!
We need to reduce the $npcNamePlural:21000249$ numbers before the damage they've done to $map:02000024$ can no longer be reversed.
Whew! That's a huge load off my shoulders. Thank you, $MyPCName$!
$MyPCName$, we've got double-trouble!
As if those $npcNamePlural:21000289$ that are ludibrifying the forest weren't bad enough, the $npcNamePlural:21000132$ deployed to deal with them have gone rogue!
We have to do something before this situation gets any more out of hand! Destroy the $npcNamePlural:21000289$ and $npcNamePlural:21000132$!
We have to do something before this situation gets any more out of hand! Destroy the $npcNamePlural:21000289$ and $npcNamePlural:21000132$!
That should slow the ludibrification of $map:02000004$ at the very least. Thanks, $MyPCName$.
$map:02000113$ is celebrated as a source of crisp, clear drinking water for all of Ellinia. The falls' powerful flow is normally enough to disperse any harmful contaminants.
However, it's breeding season for the $npcNamePlural:21000341$, and the sheer volume of their sporedust has begun making people downstream sick.
We need to reduce the $npcNamePlural:21000341$' numbers so that so that the falls will have a fighting chance to purify themselves!
We need to reduce the $npcNamePlural:21000341$' numbers so that so that the falls will have a fighting chance to purify themselves!
This is great. The water should be safe to drink soon. Thanks!
With the influx of refugees from cities which have recently been attacked by forces of darkness, there are a lot of folks not familiar with the local ecology of $map:02000129$.
As a result, it seems there have been a number of folks looking for nice tasty mushrooms who've ended up taking a bite of a $npcName:21000006$ only to hurt themselves.
In the interest of public safety, your job is to address the issue by protecting the people from themselves.
Drive out the $npcNamePlural:21000006$ so no one else tries to eat them!
Wonderful work. You've done a great service for the people of $map:02000129$.
It was bad enough when the $npcNamePlural:21000030$ at the $map:02000112$ started merging to form King Slimes...
But the waste they excrete has increased the acidity of the pristine waters of the of the $map:02000112$, and started killing the surrounding flora.
If we're going to save the forest, we have to reduce the $npcNamePlural:21000030$' numbers! Please help us, $MyPCName$!
We must wipe out the $npcNamePlural:21000030$ and save the forest!
The forest ecosystem should rebound pretty quickly, thanks to your efforts. Great work, $MyPCName$!
$MyPCName$, the unicorns need our help! Some dark magic seems to have transformed them into violent, hideous $npcNamePlural:21000109$, and it's up to us to change them back!
We've got an experimental darkness neutralization ray aboard the ship that can isolate the corruption, but you'll still have to knock the sense back into our unicorn friends.
I don't like it any more than you, but it seems to be our only choice. Sometimes the only way to help your friends is to smack them really hard.
I'll give the go-ahead to blast the area with the cure. Knock some sense into those $npcNamePlural:21000109$, to return them to their unicorny selves.
I'll give the go-ahead to blast the area with the cure. Knock some sense into those $npcNamePlural:21000109$, to return them to their unicorny selves.
Those hideous $npcNamePlural:21000109$ have been changed back into beautiful unicorns, thanks to you!
Back when $map:02000172$'s ecosystem was healthy, $npcNamePlural:21000339$ used their spore-dust to break down fallen trees and eat them.
But hormones from plastic pollution in their water supply has driven their breeding into overdrive, and now they're so numerous that they're decomposing live trees too!
Your job is to bring the $npcName:21000339$ population back under control before they kill the whole forest.
Your job is to bring the $npcName:21000339$ population back under control before they kill the whole forest.
Phew! Thanks, $MyPCName$! The forest should be safe for now.
The world has seen so much violence since Madria's attack...
And now the $npcNamePlural:21090182$ who reside in $map:02000090$ have grown jealous of their tree-neighbors' smooth and lustrous bark.
They've taken to mutilating the trees with their razor-sharp crystals, and wearing their bark as a coat. No doubt the forces of darkness had something to unusual behavior.
To save the trees of the $map:02000090$, we have no choice but to cut down the $npcNamePlural:21090182$. I'm counting on you, $MyPCName$!
To save the trees of the $map:02000090$, we have no choice but to cut down the $npcNamePlural:21090182$. I'm counting on you, $MyPCName$!
The trees should be safe for now. Thank you, $MyPCName$.
Hey, cadet. I hope you're ready to get your hands dirty, because I need you to deal with a slimy situation. BAHAHAHA! Err... It'll be funnier after I've explained.
According to witnesses, a huge number of $npcNamePlural:21000029$ have gathered at $map:02000041$. Any moment now, they may start clumping together to form King Slimes!
Needless to say, we can't allow that to happen. Your mission is to cull the $npcNamePlural:21000029$ before they grow into an even bigger threat. Well, get to work!
Your mission is to cull the $npcNamePlural:21000029$ before they grow into an even bigger threat. Well, get to work!
You really knocked the slime of them, eh cadet? ...BAHAHAHAHA!
Big news, kid! $npcNamePlural:21000078$ have been amassing in the $map:02000043$ in tremendous numbers.
I'd love it if this were just some kind of family reunion, but our scouts say they're gearing up for an assault on the nearby settlements.
I need you to disperse those mischievous fairfolk before they do some serious harm.
Dispatch $npcNamePlural:21000078$ before they hurt someone!
Nice job thinning the herd, cadet. Those $npcNamePlural:21000078$ will think twice before trying to attack another settlement.
Logging in the $map:02000017$ is tightly regulated because chopping down the enchanted trees tends to leave a lot of angry, vengeful $npcNamePlural:21000041$ behind.
But since criminals don't care about the law, the trail is full of them. Now the little vermin are running around attacking any humans they encounter.
Good thing my favorite cadet's in the neighborhood! How about you get to work deal with that $npcName:21000041$ problem?
Good thing my favorite cadet's in the neighborhood! How about you get to work deal with that $npcName:21000041$ problem?
Nicely done, kid! As I always say, there's no point fixing something when a bandage will do just fine.
Since you're over in $map:02000117$, I could use your help with something. The feral $npcName:21000062$ population in the area has gotten out of control.
I want you to thin their numbers so I don't have to deal with so much paperwork for all the travelers that go missing there.
I want you to thin their numbers so I don't have to deal with so much paperwork for all the travelers that go missing there.
Great work kid! Fewer dead travelers means fewer missing persons reports for the Royal Guard.
Hey kid, we've got a problem! The $npcNamePlural:21000079$ and $npcNamePlural:21000080$ along $map:02000118$ have gotten all uppity, and they're trying to break into Tria!
Sure, there are plenty of guards at the gate, but many of them are fresh out of training. If those rookies let even one monster through the gates, people might get hurt.
Help the Royal Guard stop those $npcNamePlural:21000079$ and $npcNamePlural:21000080$, and while you're at it, show those rookies how it's done.
Thanks. The guard's still rebuilding after the siege of Tria, but that's no excuse for letting innocent people get hurt.
Listen up, cadet! The $npcNamePlural:21000234$ of $map:02000088$ are all grown up, and they've turned to a life of gang violence!
Those hooligans are roving around mugging travelers with their slingshots. I won't stand for it! Show those $npcNamePlural:21000234$ that the law reigns supreme!
Those hooligans are roving around mugging travelers with their slingshots. I won't stand for it! Show those $npcNamePlural:21000234$ that the law reigns supreme!
Nice job, cadet! Maybe now they know that crime doesn't pay, those $npcNamePlural:21000234$ will take up a righteous path. Or not. You can always hit 'em some more!
Zombies, $MyPCName$, flesh-eating zombies!!! They've already eaten some of the geologists investigating a local anomaly, and zombified a local cat!
Yes, there's a vaccine for zombieism, but at this stage the only real cure is a good old-fashioned brain-bashing. Eliminate the zombie threat!
Clear $map:02000087$ of zombies! Quickly!
Clear $map:02000087$ of zombies! Quickly!
Nice job, kid. Now it's safe for the surviving geologists to resume their... uh... geology stuff.
The $npcNamePlural:21000077$ of $map:02000116$ are using some kind of woo-woo forest magic to snare travelers with vines and rob them of their possessions.
Considering a large number delivery people pass through the area, bringing critical supplies to Tria, we can't just let this slide.
Drive the $npcNamePlural:21000077$ out of $map:02000116$ so our delivery people can do their jobs!
Drive the $npcNamePlural:21000077$ out of $map:02000116$ so our delivery people can do their jobs!
Good work, cadet. Thanks to your efforts, we shouldn't see any more important packages go missing.
Ever since that earthquake at the $map:02000115$, it's been much harder for the guard to police monster populations around Tria.
The $npcNamePlural:21000007$ can make for good hunting in smaller numbers, but with their population boom, they've started hunting us right back.
Tourists are reluctant to visit $map:02000115$ as-is what with the gaping hole. This is too much. I want you to take out as many $npcNamePlural:21000007$ as you can!
Tourists are reluctant to visit $map:02000115$ as-is what with the gaping hole. This is too much. I want you to take out as many $npcNamePlural:21000007$ as you can!
A fine job, cadet! Hopefully the road should be a little safer now for tourists and whatnot.
Hey $MyPCName$, I've got a job for you! As you know, $map:02000114$ is a part of one of our most important trade routes, linking $map:02000062$ and $map:02000001$.
But since the road traffic has driven off the local $npcName:21000351$ population's only real predator, their slimy ooze trails have become a serious problem.
Wagon accidents are up 50%, and that means it's time for you to set things back the way nature intended, by wiping those slippery $npcNamePlural:21000351$ off the map.
Wagon accidents are up 50%, and that means it's time for you to set things back the way nature intended, by wiping those slippery $npcNamePlural:21000351$ off the map.
Great work! Thanks to you, it should be smooth sailing for all trade vehicles from now on. Well, not too smooth... BAHAHAHAHA!
SCRIPTQUEST_1122231920008448_NAME:[F]FameContents
SCRIPTQUEST_1122231920008449_NAME:[F]FameContents
SCRIPTQUEST_1122231920008450_NAME:[F]FameContents
SCRIPTQUEST_1122231920008451_NAME:[F]FameContents
SCRIPTQUEST_1122231920008452_NAME:[F]FameContents
SCRIPTQUEST_1122231920008453_NAME:[F]FameContents
$map:02000097$ is treacherous enough to navigate without all the angry $npcNamePlural:21000111$ out for human blood.
It's time somebody did something, and by somebody, I mean you. Deal with the ornery, bucktoothed menaces!
It's time somebody did something, and by somebody, I mean you. Deal with the ornery, bucktoothed menaces!
Good work! I'm sure the people of Perion will appreciate having to fish fewer bodies out of the snow!
SCRIPTQUEST_1122231920008456_NAME:[F]FameContents
SCRIPTQUEST_1122231920008457_NAME:[F]FameContents
SCRIPTQUEST_1122231920008458_NAME:[F]FameContents
SCRIPTQUEST_1122231920008459_NAME:[F]FameContents
SCRIPTQUEST_1122231920008460_NAME:[F]FameContents
SCRIPTQUEST_1122231920008461_NAME:[F]FameContents
SCRIPTQUEST_1122231920008462_NAME:[F]FameContents
SCRIPTQUEST_1122231920008463_NAME:[F]FameContents
SCRIPTQUEST_1122231920008464_NAME:[F]FameContents
SCRIPTQUEST_1122231920008465_NAME:[F]FameContents
Even though its lava floods the plains, the volcano from which the $map:02000039$ flows is technically dormant.
However, geologists warn that the burrowing $npcNamePlural:21000255$ threaten to upset the delicate pressure system allowing for the river's steady flow.
Your job is to cull the local $npcNamePlural:21000255$ population before they set off a full-scale eruption!
Your job is to cull the local $npcNamePlural:21000255$ population before they set off a full-scale eruption!
That's one less headache for me. Nicely done, cadet.
SCRIPTQUEST_1122231920008468_NAME:[F]FameContents
SCRIPTQUEST_1122231920008469_NAME:[F]FameContents
SCRIPTQUEST_1122231920008470_NAME:[F]FameContents
SCRIPTQUEST_1122231920008471_NAME:[F]FameContents
It seems the $npcNamePlural:21000088$ have become aware of the fact they've been forgotten, and are taking out their anger on anyone who happens to pass through.
I want you to secure the $map:02000010$ and put down the $npcNamePlural:21000088$' stony tantrum.
I want you to secure the $map:02000010$ and put down the $npcNamePlural:21000088$' stony tantrum.
Another headache resolved! Excellent work, cadet.
You can't take two steps at the $map:02000048$ without running ankle-first into a $npcName:21000076$. It's become a real problem for anyone who wants to get around.
$npcName:21000076$ venom is deadly, so if we don't want to have to heap any more travelers on the corpse pile, somebody's got to clean up the dig site. Get to work!
$npcName:21000076$ venom is deadly, so if we don't want to have to heap any more travelers on the corpse pile, somebody's got to clean up the dig site. Get to work!
Good work, cadet. The corpse-shovelers are in your debt. Probably some travelers too, I guess.
$MyPCName$, I have a mission which requires your skill set.
I need you to reduce the number of $npcNamePlural:21000250$ and $npcNamePlural:21000253$ in $map:02000268$.
As you may know, geothermal energy is quickly becoming a vital source of renewable energy in Maple World.
However, the $npcNamePlural:21000250$ and $npcNamePlural:21000253$ have grown so numerous that technicians cannot safely access the local geothermal energy station.
Defeat the $npcNamePlural:21000250$ and $npcNamePlural:21000253$ so that they can resume routine maintenance of the station.
Defeat the $npcNamePlural:21000250$ and $npcNamePlural:21000253$ so the technicians can resume routine maintenance of the station.
Congratulations on a job well done.
And here...
...is your mission reward.
Use it wisely.
Our survey teams say that the $npcNamePlural:21091021$ and $npcNamePlural:21091023$ at $map:02000175$ are in danger of awakening the dormant volcano with their mining.
They say it's no longer a matter of if the volcano will go off, but when.
An eruption at $map:02000175$ could cause damage on a global scale. Unfortunately, the greedy miners won't listen to reason.
There's no choice left but for us to stop them by force, for the greater good. Your mission is to drive the $npcNamePlural:21091021$ and $npcNamePlural:21091023$ out.
There's no choice left but for us to stop them by force, for the greater good. Your mission is to drive the $npcNamePlural:21091021$ and $npcNamePlural:21091023$ out.
Mission accomplished. The survey team says that the volcano is stable for now. We'll have to keep an eye on the area to make sure our miner friends never return.
$map:02000262$ has become a battlefield, full of unusual foes... abandoned toys. It's not clear what gave them life, but they are quite bitter about being discarded.
According to reports, the... ahem... "$npcNamePlural:21000171$," have proven to be especially vicious.
I need you to defeat these $npcNamePlural:21000171$ and render $map:02000262$ safe once more.
I need you to defeat these $npcNamePlural:21000171$ and render $map:02000262$ safe once more.
Well done.
We've received a distress call from the humble tribespeople of $map:02000264$.
It seems that the $npcNamePlural:21000258$ have been burrowing into the tribespeoples' igloos to get warm, and gobbling up their precious food stores.
I want you to deal with the menacing $npcNamePlural:21000258$ before any human lives are lost.
I want you to deal with the menacing $npcNamePlural:21000258$ before any human lives are lost.
Impeccable work, as always.
The $map:03000090$ was sealed in order to keep a powerful curse from spreading. Unfortunately, our advance scouts report that the seal has sprung a leak.
The curse spreads through the $npcNamePlural:40000151$ that roam the forest. Cull their numbers to keep the curse from getting any further.
The curse spreads through the $npcNamePlural:40000151$ that roam the forest. Cull their numbers to keep the curse from getting any further.
Well done. I'll have more missions for you shortly.
Our scouts report that the cunning $npcNamePlural:40000205$ of $map:03000136$ have been raising an army of sorts for their dark schemes.
The monsters of that land have proven menace enough to our forces. We cannot allow our foes to become more organized. Disperse the $npcNamePlural:40000205$ by force.
The monsters of that land have proven menace enough to our forces. We cannot allow our foes to become more organized. Disperse the $npcNamePlural:40000205$ by force.
I appreciate your efficiency.
Our scouts report that a virus that was stored in the $map:03000145$ has somehow broken containment and begun to infect humans in the lab.
It appears the virus is carried primarily by $npcNamePlural:40000074$, and its symptoms are gruesome.
Those afflicted with the virus seem to devolve into a violent, zombie-like state. We can't take the risk of someone bringing this virus back through the Shadow Gate.
Stop the spread of the virus by destroying the $npcNamePlural:40000074$, and take great care not to become infected yourself!
Stop the spread of the virus by destroying the $npcNamePlural:40000074$, and take great care not to become infected yourself!
Good work. Report to Sky Fortress's infirmary for testing and a thorough decontamination.
We have a mission from leadership of the Maple Alliance. As you can see, the $map:03000135$ is an utterly lawless place where danger lurks around every corner.
It is also a strategically valuable location in our long-term efforts to restore the Land of Darkness. As such, it's important our agents be able to operate there unharrassed.
The $npcNamePlural:40000169$ and $npcNamePlural:40000032$ who infest the area are violent, cunning, and a threat to our efforts in the area.
Your orders are to move in thin their ranks so they no longer pose a threat to our operatives.
Your orders are to move in thin their ranks so they no longer pose a threat to our operatives.
Exemplary work. I'll send word of your success to our leaders.
Scouting missions into the Land of Darkness indicate that $npcNamePlural:40000023$ taken control of the facilities at $map:03000134$.
It seems they're preparing an array of chemical weapons. While it's unlikely they'd traverse the Shadow Gate to attack our people, I'm not comfortable taking the risk.
Deal with the $npcNamePlural:40000023$ so that they never have an opportunity to use their chemical weapons.
Deal with the $npcNamePlural:40000023$ at $map:03000134$ so that they never have an opportunity to use their chemical weapons.
One less weapon in the hands of our enemies is always a win. Well done.
As the site of a gateway between our world and the Land of Darkness, it is crucial our people be able to safely traverse the $map:03000014$.
Unfortunately, the local wildlife has become a menace to our reconnaissance teams.
Neutralize the threat presented by the $npcNamePlural:40000024$ and $npcNamePlural:40000132$ so that our access to the Land of Darkness remains unimpeded.
Neutralize the threat presented by the $npcNamePlural:40000024$ and $npcNamePlural:40000132$ so that our access to the Land of Darkness remains unimpeded.
I take no pleasure in the destruction of any creatures, but we have a duty to protect the empire. Thank you for your service.
Come in, $MyPCName$. I have an urgent mission for you.
$map:02000280$ is the primary producer of carrots in Victoria Island. However, the Moon Bunnies farmers have recently been threatened by a terrible new kind of monster.
We cannot stand idly by while one of our greatest sources of produce is threatened, and our adoptive citizens are bullied!
Drive these brutes from $map:02000280$ and bring restore the peace for our Moon Bunny farmers.
You have your mission. Stop wasting time.
Well done. The Moon Bunnies should be able to farm in peace once again.
